title: Bullet kills man, grazes child in 90-year-old's home
content:
ATLANTA (CBS46) -
A six-year-old and three people were shot in Southwest Atlanta during a drive-by shooting, Sunday. One of the wounded has died according to Atlanta police.
"My dad has been the pillar of this community forever. He barely knows he's still living and he has to go through this," said a woman related to the victims who did not want to be identified.
Police said the shooting happened on Authur Langford Jr. Place just after midnight.
A bullet grazed the child's head while he slept in a bedroom in the 90-year-old's house. He and two other people are in stable condition.
A fourth person, Eugene Roberts, had gunshot wounds to the head. He later died at Grady Memorial Hospital at approximately 6:20 p.m. according to Atlanta police.
"Innocent people have been stressed out to the point that we don't even know how to talk about it," said the family member.
No arrest has been made.
If you have information which would assist in the investigation, you are asked to call Crime Stoppers at 404-577-TIPS.
